feed.title: blank
feed.subtitle: The official website for the University of California, Berkeley ICON Lab under Dr. Negar Mehr. Based on [*folio](https://github.com/bogoli/-folio) design.

entry.title: DDAT Diffusion Policies Enforcing Dynamically Admissible Robot Trajectories

link.title: DDAT Diffusion Policies Enforcing Dynamically Admissible Robot Trajectories

entry.content: Our paper titled “DDAT: Diffusion Policies Enforcing Dynamically Admissible Robot Trajectories” got accepted at the Robotics: Science and Systems (RSS) 2025! Please read more about this work at on its project page.

entry.title: CurricuLLM Automatic Task Curricula Design for Learning Complex Robot Skills using Large Language Models

link.title: CurricuLLM Automatic Task Curricula Design for Learning Complex Robot Skills using Large Language Models

entry.content: Our paper titled “CurricuLLM: Automatic Task Curricula Design for Learning Complex Robot Skills using Large Language Models” got accepted at the IEEE International Conference on Robotics and Automation (ICRA) 2025! Please read more about this work at on its project page.
entry.summary: In IEEE International Conference on Robotics and Automation (ICRA), 2025

entry.title: Learning to Provably Satisfy High Relative Degree Constraints for Black-Box Systems

link.title: Learning to Provably Satisfy High Relative Degree Constraints for Black-Box Systems

entry.content: Our paper titled “Learning to Provably Satisfy High Relative Degree Constraints for Black-Box Systems” got accepted at the 2024 Conference on Decision and Control (CDC)! Please read more about this work at on its project page.
entry.summary: In Conference on Decision and Control (CDC), 2024

entry.title: POLICEd RL Learning Closed-Loop Robot Control Policies with Provable Satisfaction of Hard Constraints

link.title: POLICEd RL Learning Closed-Loop Robot Control Policies with Provable Satisfaction of Hard Constraints

entry.content: Our paper titled “POLICEd RL: Learning Closed-Loop Robot Control Policies with Provable Satisfaction of Hard Constraints” got accepted at the Robotics: Science and Systems (RSS) 2024! Please read more about this work at on its project page.
